_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Kelso Milling Co.
1205 Main St.
Scott City, Mo. 63780
Further Information Contact:  Jeff Kirn/Plant Manager
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary

1.  Facility Policy:  The owner & employees of Kelso Milling Co. are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department and authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.
2.  Facility information:  The primary activity is the blending and storage of fertilizers for sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application by farmers.
The maximum quantity stored would be 140,000 pounds in our 2 storage tanks. One at a 12,000 gal capacity, the other at 18,000 gal.  The maxiuum quantity handled would be the unloading of a tractor-trailer with the capacity of 40,000 pounds.
3.  The accidental release prevention program.  Kelso Milling Co. has implemented the provisions of "Safety requirments for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1" published by the American National Standards Institute, Inc. and the standards of the US Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of anhydrous ammonia."
4.  The five year accident history.  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility.  Nor to our knowledge have resulted in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage or invironmental damage.
5.  The Emergency Response Program
     The facility has:
a.  a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38
b.  Provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community Right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA)
c.  A written emergency respo

nse program, in accordance with OSHA standar 29 CFR 1910.120 including pre-emergency planning and employee training.


Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  There have been recent updates to all the valves on our storage tanks. New Emergency Shut Off Valves are being installed and new water containment areas have been set up at both storage areas. We mantain extra lighting and new locking systems that help to deter theft, which has become a huge problem.  Aside from any assessed maintenance there are no recommendations at this time.
